Description: A savory dish of Italian origin
column6: flattened base of leavened wheat-based dough topped with tomatoes

Description: A Japanese dish of prepared vinegared rice
column5: usually with some sugar and salt

Description: A traditional Mexican dish consisting of a small hand-sized corn or wheat tortilla topped with a filling.
A variety of dishes originating in the Indian subcontinent that use a complex combination of spices or herbs
A Japanese noodle soup dish. It consists of Chinese-style wheat noodles served in a meat or (occasionally) fish-based broth
column5: often flavored with soy sauce or miso
column6: and uses toppings such as sliced pork

Description: A Spanish rice dish originally from Valencia. It is one of the best-known dishes in Spanish cuisine.
A sandwich consisting of one or more cooked patties of ground meat
column6: placed inside a sliced bread roll or bun.

Description: A Vietnamese soup consisting of broth
A buttery
column7: named for its historical crescent shape.

Description: A variety of cooked meat dishes
column5: with their origins in Middle Eastern cuisine.

Description: A hot dish consisting of fried battered fish and hot chips. It is a common take-away food in the United Kingdom and numerous other countries
column5: particularly in English-speaking and Commonwealth nations.

Description: A large range of small dishes that Cantonese people traditionally enjoy in restaurants for breakfast and lunch.
A soup or stew of meat and vegetables seasoned with paprika and other spices. Originating in medieval Hungary
column5: goulash is a popular meal predominantly eaten in Central Europe but also in other parts of Europe.

Description: A dish of french fries and cheese curds topped with a brown gravy. It emerged in Quebec
column6: in the late 1950s in the Centre-du-Québec region.

Description: A stir-fried rice noodle dish commonly served as a street food and at most restaurants in Thailand as part of the country's cuisine.
An eggplant- and/or potato-based dish, often including ground meat, which is common in the Balkans and the Middle East, with many local and regional variations.
A type of baked or fried turnover consisting of pastry and filling, common in Southern European, Latin American, and the Philippines cultures.

A sour soup common in Eastern Europe and Northern Asia. In English, the word 'borscht' is most often associated with the soup's variant of Ukrainian origin, made with beetroots as one of the main ingredients, which give the dish its distinctive red color.

A South American seafood dish that originated in Peru, typically made from fresh raw fish cured in fresh citrus juices, most commonly lemon or lime, and spiced with ají, chili peppers or other seasonings including chopped onions, salt, and coriander.

A rice dish from West Africa. The dish is typically made with long-grain rice, tomatoes, onions, spices, vegetables and meat in a single pot, although its ingredients and preparation methods vary across different regions.
A stew of beans with beef and pork. It is the national dish of Brazil.

Filled dumplings made by wrapping unleavened dough around a savory or sweet filling and cooking in boiling water, or pan-frying. They are associated with the cuisines of Central, Eastern and Southeastern Europe.

A type of wide, flat pasta, possibly one of the oldest types of pasta. It is an Italian dish made of stacked layers of this flat pasta alternating with fillings such as ragù and other vegetables, cheese, and seasonings and spices such as garlic, oregano and basil.

A Korean rice dish. The term 'bibim' means 'mixing' and 'bap' refers to cooked rice. It is served as a bowl of warm white rice topped with namul (sautéed and seasoned vegetables) and gochujang (chili pepper paste), soy sauce, or doenjang (a fermented soybean paste).
A Middle Eastern dish consisting of meat cut into thin slices, stacked in a cone-like shape, and roasted on a slowly-turning vertical rotisserie or spit.

A dish from Beijing (Peking) that has been prepared since the imperial era. The meat is characterized by its thin, crisp skin, with authentic versions of the dish serving mostly the skin and little meat, sliced in front of the diners by the cook.

A savoury pudding containing sheep's pluck (heart, liver, and lungs); minced with onion, oatmeal, suet, spices, and salt, mixed with stock, traditionally encased in the animal's stomach though now often in an artificial casing instead.
A type of food made of ground maize dough, originating from the northern region of South America in pre-Columbian times, and is notable in the cuisines of Colombia and Venezuela.
A North African dish of small steamed balls of crushed durum wheat semolina that is traditionally served with a stew spooned on top.

A mixed rice dish originating among the Muslims of the Indian subcontinent. It is made with Indian spices, rice, and meat (chicken, beef, goat, pork, lamb, prawn, or fish), or vegetables and sometimes, in addition, eggs and/or potatoes.
A term in Tex-Mex cuisine referring to any grilled meat that is usually served as a taco on a flour or corn tortilla.

A fried or baked pastry with a savoury filling, such as spiced potatoes, onions, peas, cheese, beef and other meats, or lentils. It may take different forms, including triangular, cone, or half-moon shapes, depending on the region.
A Middle Eastern dip, spread, or savory dish made from cooked, mashed chickpeas blended with tahini, lemon juice, and garlic.
A cut of beef first made popular in Brazil, and later adopted in Portugal. In the United States, the cut is little known and often named top sirloin cap, rump cover, rump cap, or culotte.

A traditional Korean side dish of salted and fermented vegetables, such as napa cabbage and Korean radish, made with a widely varying selection of seasonings including gochugaru (chili powder), scallions, garlic, ginger, and jeotgal (salted seafood), etc.
A type of German sausage made from veal, beef, or most commonly pork.
An Ethiopian chicken stew. It is one of the most popular and well-known of all Ethiopian dishes.
A layered pastry dessert made of filo pastry, filled with chopped nuts, and sweetened with syrup or honey. It was one of the most popular sweet pastries of Ottoman cuisine.
A strip of fried dough, sometimes filled, originating from Spain and Portugal.
A coffee-flavoured Italian dessert. It is made of ladyfingers (savoiardi) dipped in coffee, layered with a whipped mixture of eggs, sugar, and mascarpone cheese, flavoured with cocoa.
A traditional dish from Central America. Consisting of rice and beans as a base, gallo pinto has a long history and is important to various Latin American cultures.
A very thin, breaded and pan-fried cutlet made from veal. It is one of the best known specialities of Viennese cuisine, and one of the national dishes of Austria.
A Brazilian seafood stew. It is slowly cooked in a terracotta cassole.
A ground meat pie with a crust or topping of mashed potato of English origin.
A Southeast Asian fried rice dish, usually cooked with pieces of meat and vegetables. One of Indonesia's national dishes.

A traditional Georgian dish of cheese-filled bread. The bread is leavened and allowed to rise and is shaped in various ways, usually with cheese in the middle and a crust which is ripped off and used to dip in the cheese.
A deep-fried ball, doughnut or patty made from ground chickpeas, fava beans, or both. Falafel is a traditional Middle Eastern food, that most likely originated in Egypt.
A thin, crisp, round flatbread from the Indian subcontinent. It is typically based on a seasoned dough usually made from peeled black gram flour (urad flour), either fried or cooked with dry heat.
A dish made from peeled beans formed into a ball and then deep-fried in dendê (palm oil). It is a street food in the Brazilian state of Bahia, especially in the city of Salvador.
One of the national dishes of Cuba, consisting of shredded or pulled beef in a tomato-based sauce.

A Taiwanese tea-based drink invented in Tainan and Taichung in the 1980s. Most bubble tea recipes contain a tea base mixed with fruit or milk, to which chewy tapioca balls and fruit jelly are often added.

A spicy stew containing chili peppers (sometimes in the form of chili powder), meat (usually beef), and often tomatoes and beans. Its origins are disputed, but it is generally thought to have originated in Texas.
A Japanese crescent-shaped dumpling. It is the Japanese version of the Chinese jiaozi.
A traditional dish from Senegal. It is a flavorful combination of fish, rice, and tomato sauce, and it is the national dish of Senegal.
A specific type of chocolate cake, or torte, invented by Austrian Franz Sacher in 1832 for Prince Metternich in Vienna, Austria. It is one of the most famous Viennese culinary specialities.
A traditional meal from the Indian subcontinent, popular in many areas of Nepal, Bangladesh and India. It consists of steamed rice and a cooked lentil soup called dal.

A famous dish from the Cape Verde islands, West Africa. It is a slow-cooked stew of corn (hominy), beans, cassava, sweet potato, fish or meat (sausage, beef, goat or chicken), and often morcela (blood sausage).
An Indian curry dish popular in the region of Goa. The cuisine of the region is a mix of Indian and Portuguese influences.
A traditional Bulgarian food in the börek family prepared by layering a mixture of whisked eggs, natural yogurt and pieces of white brined cheese between filo pastry and then baking it in an oven.
The barbecue of a social event in Argentina and other South American countries. It is a traditional dish and also the standard word for 'barbecue'.

A type of snack that originated in the Indian subcontinent. It consists of a round, hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with a mixture of flavored water (known as imli pani), tamarind chutney, chili, chaat masala, potato, onion or chickpeas.
A Portuguese egg tart pastry, common in Portugal, and in the Lusosphere.

A popular cold dessert in the Philippines made up of crushed ice, evaporated milk or condensed milk, and various ingredients including, ube, sweetened beans, coconut strips, sago, gulaman (seaweed gelatin), pinipig rice, boiled taro or soft yams in cubes, fruit slices, flan, and topped with a scoop of ice cream.
A thin pancake or crepe, originating from South India, made from a fermented batter predominantly consisting of lentils and rice.
A North African dish which is named after the earthenware pot in which it is cooked.
A small, baked cheese roll or cheese bun, a popular snack and breakfast food in Brazil.
A type of dumpling popular in most Turkic cuisines
column5: as well as in the cuisines of the South Caucasus

Description: A family of stuffed dishes common in the cuisines of the former Ottoman Empire and surrounding regions, including Turkey, Greece, Cyprus, Iran and the Caucasus.
A type of spring roll of Chinese origin commonly found in the Philippines and Indonesia.
A dish of roasted chunks of chicken tikka in a spicy sauce. The sauce is usually creamy and orange-coloured.
A South African vegetable relish, usually spicy, that is traditionally served with bread, pap, samp, stews, or curries.
A German pot roast that can be prepared with a variety of meats—most often beef, but also venison, lamb and mutton, pork and horse.
A type of bread made with flour from the rye grain. It is typically denser than bread made from wheat flour.
A Japanese rice cake made of mochigome, a short-grain japonica glutinous rice, and sometimes other ingredients such as water, sugar, and cornstarch.
A staple food common in many countries in West Africa and Central Africa made by boiling starchy food crops like cassava, yams or plantains and then pounding them into a dough-like consistency.
A Peruvian chicken stew. The dish is a popular Peruvian comfort food, and the name translates to 'chicken chili' or 'hen's chili' in English.
A dish consisting of cooked land snails. It is a delicacy in France and other countries.
An Italian pastry dessert of the Sicily region. The singular is cannolo.
Lean trimmed meat that has been cut into strips and dried (dehydrated) to prevent spoilage.
A Levantine vegetarian salad made mostly of finely chopped parsley, with tomatoes, mint, onion, bulgur, and seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
A meringue-based dessert named after the Russian ballerina Anna Pavlova. It is a meringue dessert with a crisp crust and soft, light inside, usually topped with fruit and whipped cream.
A Vietnamese dish of grilled pork and noodle, which is thought to have originated from Hanoi, Vietnam.
A traditional Mexican dish. Typically, corn tortillas cut in quarters and lightly fried are the basis of the dish.
A breakfast dish from the Malaysian state of Sarawak, on the island of Borneo. It is a coconut-based curry noodle soup.
An Italian oven-baked folded pizza, often described as a turnover, made with leavened dough.
A traditional hot corn- and masa-based beverage of Mexican and Central American origin.
A boat-shaped version of khachapuri, a traditional Georgian cheese bread, with a raw egg added on top.
A traditional British dish consisting of sausages served with mashed potatoes. It is a popular pub dish.
A Hungarian food specialty, a deep-fried flatbread made of a dough with flour, yeast, salt and water.
A French dish made with the leg of a duck. While it is made across France, it is seen as a specialty of Gascony.
A Thai-style fried rice dish.

The Vietnamese word for bread. In Vietnamese cuisine, it also refers to a type of short baguette with thin, crisp crust and soft, airy texture inside that is often split lengthwise and filled with savory ingredients like a submarine sandwich and served as a meal.
A Sri Lankan dish made from godamba roti and vegetables, egg and/or meat, and spices.
A marinade and relish used in Algerian, Libyan, Moroccan and Tunisian cooking. It is traditionally used to flavor fish or seafood, but it can be used on other meats or vegetables.
A Belgian dish of pureed or mashed potatoes and other root vegetables, and can also include cream, bacon, onion or shallot, herbs, and spices.
A Portuguese dish made from shreds of salted cod (bacalhau), onions and thinly chopped fried potatoes, all bound with scrambled eggs.
A rice pilaf dish from Central Asia. In Uzbekistan, it is the national dish.
A dish of grape, cabbage, monk's rhubarb, or chard leaves rolled around a filling of grains, minced meat, or both.

A Swiss dish consisting mainly of potatoes, in the style of a fritter. It was originally a breakfast dish, commonly eaten by farmers in the canton of Bern, but is now eaten all over Switzerland and around the world.

A popular Filipino dish and cooking process in Filipino cuisine that involves meat, seafood, or vegetables marinated in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, bay leaves, and black peppercorns, which is then browned in oil, and simmered in the marinade.

A dip, soup, or sauce found in the cuisines of Southeast Europe and the Middle East. It is made of salted strained yogurt or diluted yogurt mixed with cucumbers, garlic, salt, olive oil, sometimes with vinegar or lemon juice, and herbs such as dill, mint, parsley and thyme.
A variety of jjigae, or stew-like Korean dish, made with kimchi and other ingredients, such as pork, scallions, onions, and diced tofu.
A traditional soup in several Latin American cuisines. It usually consists of large pieces of meat, tubers and vegetables served in a broth.
A stew or sauce common to much of West Africa. It is a peanut-based stew.

A dish from Beijing (Peking) that has been prepared since the imperial era. The meat is characterized by its thin, crisp skin, with authentic versions of the dish serving mostly the skin and little meat, sliced in front of the diners by the cook.
A Maghrebi dish of eggs poached in a sauce of tomatoes, olive oil, peppers, onion and garlic, commonly spiced with cumin, paprika and cayenne pepper.
A vegetarian fast food dish native to the state of Maharashtra in India. It consists of a deep fried potato dumpling placed inside a bread bun (pav) sliced almost in half through the middle.

A Brazilian dish made of frozen and mashed açaí palm fruit. It is served as a smoothie in a bowl or glass, and is commonly topped with granola and banana, and then other fruits and guaraná syrup are added on top.
A traditional Catalan and Andorran soup and stew. It is characterized by the use of a 'pilota', a very big meatball spiced with garlic and parsley.
A national dish in Albania. It is a dish of lamb and rice baked with a mixture of yogurt and eggs.
A boiled beef dish, popular in Austria and the German state of Bavaria.
A traditional Azerbaijani dish of stuffed vine leaves. The filling is a mixture of minced lamb, rice, and herbs.
A popular Bahamian dish made from conch, a type of sea snail. The conch is tenderized, breaded, and deep-fried.
A traditional Bahraini dish of spiced rice and meat (usually chicken or lamb). It is similar to biryani.
A traditional dish from Burkina Faso. It is a rice dish cooked in a tomato and onion sauce, often with meat or fish.
A rice noodle and fish soup from Myanmar. It is an essential part of Burmese cuisine, and is considered by many to be the national dish.
A Cameroonian dish consisting of stewed nuts, ndoleh (bitter leaves indigenous to West Africa), and fish or beef.
A grilled dish of minced meat found traditionally in the countries of southeast Europe (the Balkans). They are considered a national dish in Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia.
A traditional Croatian dish of meat or seafood and vegetables cooked under a bell-like lid covered in hot embers. It is a popular dish in the Dalmatia region.

A traditional Czech meat dish. It is a sirloin steak prepared with vegetables (carrots, parsley root, celeriac, and onion), spiced with black pepper, allspice, bay leaf, and thyme, and boiled with double cream. It is generally served with houskové knedlíky (bread dumplings).
A traditional Djiboutian dish of rice and lamb. It is a one-pot meal, and is often served with a spicy sauce.
A variety of pilaf made in Afghanistan. It consists of steamed rice mixed with raisins, carrots, and beef or lamb.
Flat, pan-fried meatballs of minced meat, often likened to the Danish version of meatballs. They are a popular dish in Denmark and other Nordic countries.
A popular Costa Rican dish consisting of rice, beans, chicharrón (fried pork), and pico de gallo.
The national dish of the Dominican Republic. It consists of rice, red beans, and meat (beef, chicken, or pork).
An Egyptian dish of rice, macaroni, and lentils mixed together, topped with a spiced tomato sauce, and garlic vinegar; garnished with chickpeas and crispy fried onions.
A traditional Salvadoran dish of a thick corn tortilla stuffed with a savory filling.
An Ethiopian chicken stew. It is one of the most popular and well-known of all Ethiopian dishes.
A traditional Fijian feast where food is cooked in an earth oven. A variety of meats, fish, and vegetables are wrapped in banana leaves and cooked for several hours.
A traditional Finnish pea soup. It is usually served on Thursdays, and is often accompanied by pancakes for dessert.
A spicy dish prepared with onions and either marinated poultry or marinated fish. Originally from Senegal, yassa has become popular throughout West Africa.
A traditional Venezuelan dish, the local version of the rice and beans combination found throughout the Caribbean. It is a plate of rice, shredded beef in a stew, and stewed black beans.
A popular Haitian dish of fried pork. It is often served with pikliz (a spicy cabbage relish) and fried plantains.
A traditional Honduran dish that typically includes grilled meat, fried plantains, rice, beans, and a salad.
A selection of traditional Icelandic food, consisting mainly of meat and fish products cured in a traditional manner, cut into slices or pieces and served with rúgbrauð (dense and dark rye bread).
The national dish of Iran. It is a dish of steamed, saffroned Persian rice and kabab.
A traditional Iraqi dish of grilled fish. The fish is slow-grilled for several hours after being marinated with tamarind, and is often served with rice, lemon, and pickles.
A traditional Irish dish made from lamb or mutton, potatoes, onions, and parsley.
A traditional Yemenite Jewish pastry, served on Shabbat morning. It is prepared from rolled dough which is baked on very low heat for about ten hours.

A Milanese speciality of cross-cut veal shanks braised with vegetables, white wine and broth. It is often garnished with gremolata and traditionally served with either risotto alla milanese or polenta, depending on the regional variation.
The national dish of Jamaica. It is made from ackee and salted codfish.
A type of udon noodle soup from the city of Nagoya in central Japan. The soup is flavored with miso, and typically contains chicken, a raw egg, and other ingredients.
A traditional Jordanian dish made of lamb cooked in a sauce of fermented dried yogurt and served with rice or bulgur.
A traditional dish of Central Asian nomads. The term beshbarmak means 'five fingers' in the Turkic languages, because nomads traditionally eat this dish with their hands.
A type of corn flour porridge made in Africa. It is a staple food in many African countries, and is often served with stews or other dishes.
A gui (Korean-style grilled or roasted dish) made of thin, marinated slices of beef or pork grilled on a barbecue or on a stove-top griddle.
A traditional Kuwaiti dish of spiced rice and meat. It is similar to biryani.
A traditional Central Asian dish of pulled noodles, meat, and vegetables. It is popular in Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan, and Uzbekistan.
A type of Lao meat salad that is regarded as the unofficial national dish of Laos. It is also eaten in the Isan region of Thailand, where the population is predominantly of Lao ethnicity.
A Latvian pastry, often consisting of a bread roll filled with a savory or sweet filling. It is a popular snack in Latvia.

A Levantine dish made of bulgur, minced onions, and finely ground lean beef, lamb, goat, or camel meat with Middle Eastern spices (cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, allspice). The best-known variety is a torpedo-shaped fried croquette stuffed with cooked minced beef or lamb with onion and pine nuts.
A South African barbecue. The word 'braai' is Afrikaans for 'barbecue' or 'roast' and is a social custom in South Africa, Botswana, Namibia, Lesotho, Swaziland, Zimbabwe, Zambia and Malawi.
A type of soft egg noodle found in the cuisines of southern Germany and Austria, Switzerland, Hungary, Alsace, Moselle and South Tyrol. The name means 'little sparrows'.
A Lithuanian national dish of dumplings made from grated and riced potatoes and stuffed with ground meat, dry cottage cheese or mushrooms. It is served with a sour cream sauce and bacon bits.
A Luxembourgish potato pancake. It is a popular snack and street food in Luxembourg.
A traditional Macedonian dish of beans cooked in a skillet. It is the national dish of North Macedonia.
The national dish of Madagascar. It is a stew of beef, pork, and greens, and is often served with rice.
A type of corn flour porridge made in Africa. It is a staple food in Malawi, and is often served with stews or other dishes.
A Malay fragrant rice dish cooked in coconut milk and pandan leaf. It is commonly found in Malaysia, where it is considered the national dish.
A traditional Maldivian fish soup. It is made with tuna, and is often served with rice, lime, and chili.
A traditional Mauritanian dish of couscous served with roasted lamb. It is a popular dish for special occasions.
A popular Mauritian dish of octopus cooked in a curry sauce. It is often served with rice or bread.
A traditional Mexican sauce and the national dish of Mexico. It is a thick, dark sauce made from a variety of chilies, spices, and chocolate.
A national dish of Iceland consisting of a Greenland shark or a basking shark which has been cured with a particular fermentation process and hung to dry for four to five months.
A popular Tanzanian dish of marinated and grilled meat skewers. It is often served with a salad and a dipping sauce.

A type of stew, originally from Spain, prepared in Yucatán, Mexico, Argentina, Paraguay, Uruguay, Perú, south of Brazil, the Philippines, and Spain, specifically the autonomous communities of Andalusia and the Canary Islands. The name comes from the Spanish word 'puchero' which means 'stewpot'.
A round platter used to serve food in South Asia, Southeast Asia and the Caribbean. Thali is also a meal made up of a selection of various dishes which are served on a platter.
A traditional Paraguayan dish. Literally meaning 'Paraguayan soup', it is similar to a savory cornbread. Corn flour, cheese, milk and onions are common ingredients.
A variety of fried foods prepared principally of pork, in Puerto Rican cuisine. In a broader sense, it refers to any of various fried dishes sold by street vendors or cuchifritos.
A Vietnamese savory fried pancake made of rice flour, water, and turmeric powder. It is stuffed with slivers of fatty pork, shrimp, diced green onion, and bean sprouts.
A sour fermented flatbread with a slightly spongy texture, traditionally made out of teff flour. It is the national dish in Ethiopia and Eritrea.
The national dish of the Dominican Republic. It consists of rice, red beans, and meat (beef, chicken, or pork).
A Korean fried rice dish. It is a popular and easy-to-make dish, and can be made with a variety of ingredients.

A Spanish word meaning 'toasted'. In Mexico and other parts of Latin America, it is the name of various local dishes which are toasted or use a toasted ingredient as the main base of their preparation.

A breakfast dish eaten in the South Indian states of Kerala, Tamil Nadu and parts of Karnataka, as well as Sri Lanka. Puttu means 'portioned' in Tamil and Malayalam. It is made of steamed cylinders of ground rice layered with coconut shavings, sometimes with a sweet or savory filling.
A savory snack that originated in India, typically served as an hors d'oeuvre at roadside tracks from stalls or food carts across the Indian subcontinent in India, Pakistan, Nepal and Bangladesh.
A Peruvian shrimp chowder. It is a popular dish in the coastal regions of Peru.
A traditional English dessert consisting of a mixture of strawberries, meringue, and cream. It was first mentioned in print in 1893, and is believed to have originated at Eton College.

An Indonesian and Malaysian dish consisting of deep-fried chicken. The name 'ayam goreng' literally means 'fried chicken' in Malay (including both Indonesian and Malaysian standards) and also in many Indonesian regional languages (e.g. Javanese).
A German potato salad. It is a popular dish in Germany and other parts of Central Europe.
A stew from Belgium and originating in Flanders. The name of the dish is Dutch for 'watery mess', sometimes translated as 'boiling water'.
A Portuguese dish of codfish cooked with potatoes, onions, and garlic in a large amount of olive oil.

A rice dish, or in some regions, a wheat dish, whose recipe usually involves cooking in stock or broth, adding spices, and other ingredients such as vegetables or meat, and employing some technique for achieving cooked grains that do not adhere.

A brand of savoury food spread from the United Kingdom, based on yeast extract invented by German scientist Justus von Liebig. It is made from by-products of beer brewing and is produced by the British company Unilever.
A Puerto Rican salt cod fritter. It is a popular snack and appetizer.
A Turkish dish of chicken in a walnut sauce. It is a popular dish in the Circassian diaspora.
A sort of white bread roll or sweet roll eaten as a meal or as a dessert in Germany, Austria and in France (Alsace). It is a typical dish in southern Germany.

A Hungarian sponge cake layered with chocolate buttercream and topped with caramel. The five-layer pastry is named after its inventor, Hungarian chef József C. Dobos, a delicatessen owner in Budapest.

A traditional soup of Ecuador served on Good Friday. It is a rich soup, with the primary ingredients being figleaf gourd (sambo), pumpkin (zapallo), and twelve different kinds of beans and grains, plus bacalhau (salt cod) cooked in milk.
A Greek and Cypriot soup of dry white beans, olive oil, and vegetables, sometimes called the 'national food of the Greeks'.
A seafood dish originally from the coast of Valencia which is similar to paella. Its main ingredients are pasta noodles (usually hollow), fish, and shellfish. It is seasoned with lemon and aioli.
A popular Ghanaian dish of fufu served with a light soup. The soup is typically made with tomatoes, onions, and peppers, and can be made with or without meat.
An Iranian herb stew. It is a very popular dish in Iran.
A type of pancake made from a fermented batter of rice flour and coconut milk. It is a popular breakfast dish in Sri Lanka.
A Jamaican dish of chicken marinated in a spicy jerk sauce and then grilled. It is a popular dish in Jamaica and other parts of the Caribbean.
A savory dish of smoked pork collar and broad beans, which is one of the most widely recognized national dishes of Luxembourg.
A traditional Turkish stew made with cabbage and meat. It is a popular dish in the winter.
A Thai-style fried rice dish.
A Swedish dish of meatballs, typically served with gravy, boiled potatoes, lingonberry jam, and sometimes pickled cucumber.
A Turkish baked potato with a variety of fillings. It is a popular street food in Turkey.

A round, thin piece of dough topped with minced meat (most commonly beef or lamb), minced vegetables and herbs including onions, tomatoes and parsley, and spices such as cayenne pepper, paprika, cumin and cinnamon, then baked.
A Hungarian thick vegetable ragout or stew which features yellow pointed peppers, tomato, onion, salt, and ground sweet and/or hot paprika as a base.

A popular, traditional Peruvian dish, a stir fry that typically combines marinated strips of sirloin (or other beef steak) with onions, tomatoes, french fries, and other ingredients; and is typically served with rice.
A variety of biryani from the Malabar region of Kerala. It is made with Khaima rice, ghee, and a variety of spices.
A popular Levantine food consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat. Similar to a pizza, it can be sliced or folded, and it can be served either for breakfast or lunch.
A handheld pie with a filling of meat and gravy. It is a popular snack and meal in Australia and New Zealand.
A South African dessert consisting of a sweet pastry crust containing a creamy filling made from milk, flour, sugar and eggs.
A popular Levantine dip made from eggplant, tahini, and garlic.
A popular Thai street food dish of stir-fried meat or seafood with holy basil and other ingredients. It is often served with rice and a fried egg.
A dish of boiled cornmeal that was historically made from other grains. It may be served as a hot porridge, or it may be allowed to cool and solidify into a loaf that can be baked, fried, or grilled.
A South Indian soup, traditionally prepared using tamarind juice as a base, with the addition of tomato, chili pepper, pepper, cumin and other spices as seasonings.
A rich and tender coconut beef stew which is explosively flavorful. It is one of the most famous dishes from Indonesia.
A popular snack in Belize. It is a puffy, deep-fried tortilla topped with a variety of ingredients, such as shredded chicken, cabbage, and pickled onions.
A Ghanaian hot pepper sauce. It is a popular condiment in Ghana, and is often served with kenkey, banku, or other dishes.
A Swedish salad made from shrimp, mayonnaise, and dill. It is often served on toast or as a filling for sandwiches.
A popular Greek fast food consisting of small pieces of meat and sometimes vegetables grilled on a skewer. It is usually eaten straight off the skewer while still hot.
A type of soft egg noodle found in the cuisines of southern Germany and Austria, Switzerland, Hungary, Alsace, Moselle and South Tyrol. The name means 'little sparrows'.
A Romanian chicken noodle soup. It is a popular comfort food in Romania.
A lightly-salted fermented Baltic Sea herring. It is a traditional dish from northern Sweden, and is known for its strong, pungent smell.
A Levantine vegetarian salad made mostly of finely chopped parsley, with tomatoes, mint, onion, bulgur, and seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
A type of hot and sour Thai soup, usually cooked with shrimp (prawn).
A Senegalese peanut stew. It is a popular dish in Senegal and other parts of West Africa.
A kind of spit cake. It is made from rolled dough that is wrapped around a stick, then grilled and topped with sugar and walnut mix.
A popular Korean food made from small-sized garae-tteok (long, white, cylinder-shaped rice cakes) called tteokmyeon or commonly tteokbokki-tteok.
A Brazilian dish made from bread, shrimp, coconut milk, finely ground peanuts and palm oil mashed into a creamy paste.
A vegetarian version of the traditional Scottish dish of haggis. It is made from a mixture of vegetables, oatmeal, and spices.
A Chinese dish consisting of thick wheat noodles topped with zhajiang sauce. The sauce is made by simmering stir-fried ground pork or beef with salty fermented soybean paste.
A Mexican dessert made from curdled milk. It is a popular dish in the state of Michoacán.
A semi-hard, unripened brined cheese made from a mixture of goat's and sheep's milk, and sometimes also cow's milk. It has a high melting point and so can easily be fried or grilled.
A traditional Hungarian yeast roll, made in a crescent shape. It is a popular breakfast pastry in Hungary.
Small dumplings filled with ground meat, mashed potatoes or another filling, usually boiled and served in chicken soup, though they may also be served fried.
A Lithuanian potato pudding. It is a popular dish in Lithuania, and is often served with bacon and sour cream.
A Native Hawaiian dish. In the Hawaiian language, lau lau means 'leaf leaf'. It is a dish of pork wrapped in taro leaves.
A Greek dessert made from deep-fried dough soaked in syrup or honey. It is similar to a doughnut.
A traditional Peruvian dessert made from purple corn. It is a popular dish in Peru, and is often served with rice pudding.
A traditional Croatian layer cake originating from the Međimurje County. It is made with four fillings: walnuts, cottage cheese, poppy seeds, and apples.
A traditional Italian wedding soup. It is a hearty soup made with green vegetables and meat.
A Kenyan dish of black beans and maize. It is a popular dish in the Central Province of Kenya.
A whole spice blend, originating from the Indian subcontinent, used in the cuisine of the eastern Indian subcontinent and the Southern regions of Nepal. The name literally means 'five spices'.

A dish originating in Middlesbrough, Teesside, and a popular take-away food in the North East of England. It consists of a breaded cutlet of chicken or pork topped with a white béchamel sauce and cheese, usually cheddar cheese.
A traditional Chilean dish made from corn. It is a popular comfort food in Chile.
A traditional Slovenian nut roll. It is a popular dessert in Slovenia, and is often served at holidays and other special occasions.
A complex spice blend from North Africa. The name means 'head of the shop' in Arabic, and it is said to be a mixture of the best spices the seller has to offer.
A Southeast Asian dish of seasoned, skewered and grilled meat, served with a sauce. It is a popular dish in Indonesia, Malaysia, and other parts of Southeast Asia.

A thick purée in Greek cuisine made by combining crushed garlic with a bulky base — which may be a purée of potatoes, walnuts, almonds, or liquid-soaked stale bread — and then beating in olive oil to make a smooth emulsion.
A traditional Pakistani sweet. It is a dense, sweet confection or halva, and is a specialty of the city of Multan.
A traditional Mesoamerican dish, made of masa or dough, which is steamed in a corn husk or banana leaf. The wrapping can either be discarded prior to eating or used as a plate.
A cold soup from Bulgaria. It is made of yogurt, cucumbers, garlic, walnuts, dill, vegetable oil, and water, and is a popular dish in the summer.
The culinary term for the stomach of a farm animal. In Portugal, it is a popular dish in the city of Porto.
A traditional Ukrainian dish of filled dumplings. They are made with a variety of fillings, such as potatoes, cheese, and sauerkraut.
A Russian term for hot and cold hors d'oeuvres, entrées and snacks, served before the main course. It is a popular tradition in Russia and other post-Soviet countries.
A Middle Eastern fritter or doughnut. It is a popular street food in Egypt and other parts of the Middle East.
A dessert made from rice mixed with water or milk and other ingredients such as cinnamon and raisins.
A Romanian sour soup. It is a popular dish in Romania, and is often served as a first course.
A dish of the Balkans and Asia Minor, consisting of lamb or goat intestines wrapped around seasoned offal, including sweetbreads, hearts, lungs, or kidneys, and typically grilled.
A dried, hard sausage usually made from pork and a high content of fat. It is normally smoked, sweetened, and seasoned with rose water, rice wine and soy sauce.
A popular Levantine food consisting of dough topped with thyme, cheese, or ground meat. Similar to a pizza, it can be sliced or folded, and it can be served either for breakfast or lunch.
An Igbo delicacy that is served in most restaurants in Nigeria. It is a spicy cow foot dish.
A traditional Peruvian dish baked with the aid of hot stones. The earthen oven is known as a huatia. It is a popular dish in the Andean regions of Peru.
A dish of one or more ingredients diced or minced and bound with a sauce or liquid. In Colombia, it is a fruit salad with a liquid base.
A traditional Mexican soup. It is made from chicken broth, tomatoes, and chili peppers, and is often served with tortilla strips, avocado, and cheese.
A pizza-like dish originating from the Levant, and is a popular dish in Lebanon, Syria, and Palestine.

A traditional vegetable dish from Majorca, consisting of layers of sliced potatoes, aubergines and red bell peppers previously fried in olive oil. It is available at almost any local restaurant on the island.
A Peruvian fried rice dish. It is a chifa style dish, a mix of Peruvian and Chinese food.
A traditional Portuguese soup. It is made with potatoes, collard greens, and chorizo.
A South Asian dish of rice and lentils. It is a popular comfort food in India, and is often served with yogurt or a pickle.
A traditional Jewish soup. It is made with matzah balls, which are dumplings made from matzah meal, eggs, water, and fat.
A traditional Honduran seafood stew that is rich and savory. It's a coastal specialty made with a coconut milk base and a variety of fresh seafood.
A spicy dish prepared with onions and either marinated poultry or marinated fish. Originally from Senegal, yassa has become popular throughout West Africa.
A Middle Eastern dessert commonly served during the month of Ramadan, a sweet dumpling filled with cream or nuts.
A classic French dish, in which a roasted duck is served with a bigarade sauce, a sauce made with the juice of bitter oranges.
A Singaporean seafood dish. Mud crabs are commonly used and are stir-fried in a semi-thick, sweet and savoury tomato-and-chilli-based sauce.
An Indonesian salad of raw, slightly boiled, blanched or steamed vegetables and hard-boiled eggs, boiled potato, fried tofu and tempeh, and lontong, served with a peanut sauce dressing.
A traditional Thai dessert made with glutinous rice, fresh mango and coconut milk.
A Greek baked pasta dish with ground meat and béchamel sauce.
A Russian and Ukrainian baked or fried yeast-leavened boat-shaped bun with a variety of fillings.
A small, typically half-moon-shaped, breaded and deep-fried croquette from Portugal.

A Chinese preserved food product and delicacy made by preserving duck, chicken or quail eggs in a mixture of clay, ash, salt, quicklime, and rice hulls for several weeks to several months, depending on the method of processing.
Fried plantain slices, a popular side dish in the Caribbean.
A type of sandwich served hot, which has a filling of tuna salad and cheese. It is a classic American comfort food.
An upside-down pastry in which the fruit (usually apples) are caramelized in butter and sugar before the tart is baked.
A traditional Lebanese dish of meat dumplings in a yogurt-based stew.
A Venezuelan dessert made with eggs, condensed milk, and caramel. It is a type of flan.
A traditional Chilean seafood stew usually served in an earthenware bowl (paila).
A Northern Thai noodle soup dish. It is a coconut-based curry noodle soup.
A Jamaican dish where pork is dry-rubbed or wet marinated with a hot spice mixture called Jamaican jerk spice.
A Chinese cooking method, prepared with a simmering pot of soup stock at the dining table, containing a variety of East Asian foodstuffs and ingredients.
A Korean steamed egg casserole, which is a popular side dish in Korea.
A Levantine salad made from toasted or fried pieces of khubz (Arabic flatbread) combined with mixed greens and other vegetables, such as radishes and tomatoes.
An unleavened flatbread originating from the Indian subcontinent and staple in India, Nepal, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, East Africa and the Caribbean.

A type of food made of ground maize dough, originating from the northern region of South America in pre-Columbian times, and is notable in the cuisines of Colombia and Venezuela. This is a duplicate entry.
A common name for any of a group of small to very large sea snails, marine gastropod molluscs in the family Haliotidae.
A chilled Japanese noodle dish made from buckwheat noodles.
An Ethiopian lamb stew. It is a spicy and flavorful dish.
A Vietnamese savory (mặn) or sweet (ngọt) dish made from glutinous rice and other ingredients.

A dish consisting of a hot cheese-based sauce served over slices of toasted bread. The original 18th-century name of the dish was the jocular 'Welsh rabbit', which was later reinterpreted as 'rarebit', as the dish contains no rabbit.
A dish originating from the Indian subcontinent, most common in South Indian, Maharashtrian, and Sri Lankan Tamil breakfast, cooked as a thick porridge from dry-roasted semolina or coarse rice flour.
A traditional Italian cake made with chocolate and either almonds or walnuts. Named for the island of Capri from which it originates.

A collective term for any sweet, warm soup or custard served as a dessert at the end of a meal in Cantonese cuisine. 'Tong sui' are a Cantonese specialty and are rarely found in other regional cuisines of China.
An Indian dish of small pieces of meat or vegetables marinated in a spice mixture.

A Japanese dish that is prepared and served in the nabemono (Japanese hot pot) style. It consists of meat (usually thinly sliced beef) which is slowly cooked or simmered at the table, alongside vegetables and other ingredients, in a shallow iron pot in a mixture of soy sauce, sugar, and mirin.
A Costa Rican plantain soup. It is a simple, yet flavorful soup.
A thick, spicy and sour soup of Russian origin that is common in Russia, Ukraine, and other states of the former Soviet Union and certain parts of the former Eastern Bloc.
A type of soup usually based on meat stock and onions, and often served gratinéed with croutons and cheese on top of a large piece of bread.
A Chinese dish which originated from the cuisine of Sichuan province and the name literally means 'water boiled fish'. The fish is poached in a spicy broth.
A food made from gluten, the main protein of wheat.
A traditional soup originating from Andalusia, southern Spain, made of tomato, bread, extra virgin olive oil and garlic.
Any of a variety of Greek dishes prepared in a small, two-handled frying pan, the best-known being an appetizer of fried cheese.
An Indian-influenced flatbread dish found in several countries in Southeast Asia, including Malaysia, Brunei, Indonesia and Singapore.
A sweet fruit dish from Denmark and Northern Germany. The name of the dish in Danish literally means 'red porridge'.
A northern Italian rice dish cooked with broth until it reaches a creamy consistency.
A French tart consisting of pastry crust filled with savoury custard and pieces of cheese, meat, seafood or vegetables.
A type of cake traditionally made with a pound of each of four ingredients: flour, butter, eggs, and sugar.
A traditional French Flemish dish, which can be translated into English as 'potted meat'. It is a cold dish of white meats in a savory jelly.
A North African meat or seafood pie made with warqa dough, which is similar to filo. It is a specialty of Morocco and Algeria.
A Peruvian appetizer of boiled yellow potatoes in a spicy, creamy sauce called Huancaína sauce.
A leavened, oven-baked flatbread found in the cuisines mainly of West Asia, Central Asia, Southeast Asia, the Indian subcontinent and the Caribbean.
A traditional Japanese soup consisting of a dashi stock into which softened miso paste is mixed.
A South American variation of an Italian dish where generic types of breaded meat fillet preparations are known as a milanesa.
A flavorful and spicy fried noodle dish common in Indonesia, Malaysia, and Singapore.
A Portuguese fish stew. It is a popular dish in the Algarve region.
A dish of dried, shredded beef from Northern Mexico. It is a popular breakfast dish.
A Burmese noodle soup. It is a popular dish in Myanmar, and is often served for breakfast.
A Thai rice soup. It is a popular breakfast dish in Thailand.
A Polish potato soup. It is a popular comfort food in Poland.
A Turkish dish of stuffed eggplant. It is a popular dish in Turkey, and is often served as a main course.
A popular dish of West African, French (especially Provençal), and Spanish influence, consisting mainly of meat and vegetables mixed with rice.

A dish of poached chicken and seasoned rice, served with chili sauce and usually with cucumber garnishes. It was created by immigrants from Hainan in southern China and adapted from the Hainanese dish Wenchang chicken.
A Greek dish made from meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie. It is usually served in a pita bread with tomato, onion, and tzatziki sauce.
A German meatball. It is a popular dish in Germany, and is often served with potatoes and a sauce.
A corn tortilla rolled around a filling and covered with a savory sauce. Enchiladas can be filled with various ingredients, including meats, cheese, beans, potatoes, vegetables or combinations.
A Bhutanese stew made from chili peppers and cheese. It is the national dish of Bhutan.
A guinea pig. It is a popular dish in the Andean regions of South America.
A thick Scottish soup made of smoked haddock, potatoes and onions. An authentic Cullen skink will use finnan haddie, but it may be prepared with any other undyed smoked haddock.
A Colombian milk soup. It is a popular breakfast dish in the Andean regions of Colombia.
An Italian pasta dish from Rome made with eggs, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper.
A Portuguese dish of codfish, potatoes, eggs, and olives.

A Vietnamese savory but sometimes sweetened cake made from glutinous rice, which is rolled in a banana leaf into a thick, log-like cylindrical shape, with a mung bean or mung bean and pork filling, then boiled. After cooking, the banana leaf is removed and the cake is sliced into wheel-shaped servings.
A family of sauces and soups made with egg yolk and lemon juice mixed with broth, heated until they thicken. They are found in Greek, Arab, Sephardic Jewish, Turkish, Balkan and Italian cuisine.
A vegetarian dish from the Indian subcontinent made with potatoes (aloo), cauliflower (gobi), and Indian spices.
A long, hand-minced meat kebab mounted on a wide iron skewer and grilled on an open mangal filled with burning charcoal.
